metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6949 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in CHICKEN Scheme through 4.12.0. When using a nonstandard CHICKEN-specific extension to allocate an SRFI-4 vector in unmanaged memory, the vector size would be used in unsanitised form as an argument to malloc(). With an unexpected size, the impact may have been a segfault or buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-6949` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chicken-bin - 4.12.0-0.3
libchicken11 - 4.12.0-0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chicken package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.12.0-0.3').
